SEARCH
Package Model

Class Advance

java.lang.Object
Model.Advance
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Orders
public class Advance extends Object implements Orders, Serializable
Represents an Advance order in the game, which moves armies from a source country to a target country. This order is issued by a player and contains the number of armies to be moved.
Author:
Akhilesh Kanbarkar
See Also:

    • execute

      public void execute(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Executes the Advance Order by handling army movement between countries. It checks for ownership, executes deployment, triggers battles, or conquers territory.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Orders
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state

    • conquerTargetCountry

      private void conquerTargetCountry(CurrentState p_currentState, Player p_playerOfTargetCountry, Country p_targetCountry)
      Transfers ownership of the target country from the defending player to the attacking player, updates army count, logs the conquest, and refreshes continent ownership.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state.
      p_playerOfTargetCountry - the player currently owning the target country.
      p_targetCountry - the country being conquered.

    • updateContinents

      private void updateContinents(Player p_intitiatingPlayer, Player p_playerOfTargetCountry, CurrentState p_currentState)
      Updates the continent ownership for the two players involved in the battle, based on the current ownership of countries.
      Parameters:
      p_intitiatingPlayer - the player who initiated the attack.
      p_playerOfTargetCountry - the player who owned the target country.
      p_currentState - the current state of the game.

    • getPlayerOfTargetCountry

      private Player getPlayerOfTargetCountry(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Retrieves the player who currently owns the target country (excluding Neutral player).
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state.
      Returns:
      the player who owns the target country, or null if not found.

      public boolean valid(CurrentState p_currentState)

      Parameters:

    • battleOrderResult

      private void battleOrderResult(CurrentState p_currentState, Player p_playerOfTargetCountry, Country p_sourceCountry, Country p_targetCountry)
      Executes the result of a battle between attacking and defending armies, and updates continent control accordingly.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state.
      p_playerOfTargetCountry - the player who owns the target country.
      p_sourceCountry - the source country from which the attack was initiated.
      p_targetCountry - the target country under attack.

    • produceBattleResult

      private void produceBattleResult(Country p_sourceCountry, Country p_targetCountry, List<Integer> p_attackerArmies, List<Integer> p_defenderArmies, Player p_playerOfTargetCountry)
      Produces the battle outcome based on attacker and defender army units. Delegates to handleSurvivingArmies for post-battle updates.
      Parameters:
      p_sourceCountry - the source country.
      p_targetCountry - the target country.
      p_attackerArmies - the list of attacker's army strengths.
      p_defenderArmies - the list of defender's army strengths.
      p_playerOfTargetCountry - the player defending the target country.

    • handleSurvivingArmies

      private void handleSurvivingArmies(Integer p_attackerArmiesLeft, Integer p_defenderArmiesLeft, Country p_sourceCountry, Country p_targetCountry, Player p_playerOfTargetCountry)
      Handles the outcome of the battle by updating army counts and ownership of the involved countries depending on the remaining armies.
      Parameters:
      p_attackerArmiesLeft - remaining attacker armies.
      p_defenderArmiesLeft - remaining defender armies.
      p_sourceCountry - the source country.
      p_targetCountry - the target country.
      p_playerOfTargetCountry - the player who owned the target country.

    • generateRandomArmyUnits

      private List<Integer> generateRandomArmyUnits(int p_armiesInAttack, String p_role)
      Generates a list of random integers representing army unit strengths for either the attacker or the defender using a role-based probability.
      Parameters:
      p_armiesInAttack - number of armies participating in the battle.
      p_role - "attacker" or "defender".
      Returns:
      a list of random army strengths.

    • getRandomInteger

      private int getRandomInteger()
      Generates a random integer between 1 and 9 inclusive.
      Returns:
      a random integer.
